ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: i learned how to write a proper thesis statement and meaningful topic sentences for each paragraph. also, not to gatekeep information at the beginning, but rather to present my thesis and then convince the reader by the end of my essay

This course was an excellent!! It was just as amazing as a name like "Paris in the 1920's suggests". I was introduced to Hemingway for the first time and the book we read "The Sun Also Rises" is now one of my favourites! I learnt a competely new way to write an essay and a thesis and my writing significantly improved under Professor Young's guidance!

I learned a lot about the writers, influences, and artistic movements of Paris in the 1920s. I also developed skills in essay writing and close reading, such as writing a proper thesis and careful analysis of text.
I learned some analytical writing techniques and developed my literary analysis skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: i liked the discussion in class

There are only strengths! We covered not only literature but spoke a lot about art and culture at the time. We analysed several novels in depths over a number of weeks, looked at a variety of poems, autobiographies and also discussed art and letters. Alonside deep analysis of literature, we talked about the interesting relationships between authors that we studied; the works were not only a pleasure to read, but a pleasure to talk about because their history is so interesting!!

The strengths of this course are its small seminar format and the range of work that we looked at. The workload was also very manageable and usually was juts reading the assigned readings and working on our essays when we had them. The weakness of this course is that we do have to go through the works we're looking at rather quickly and don't have the time to finish every single one.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100% yes!! The Professor is amazing and the books we read were beautiful! Paris in the 1920's is a glamorized time-period and we thoroughly disected the mystique while all falling prey to it. In this class, the glamour of Paris is brought to life. We had incredibly interesting social and cultural discussions and I couldn't recomment the course more!!

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. I thought the course material was really interesting and the range of work we looked at was also very broad. It was a good opportunity to explore works from this time period and place, learn more about the authors, and also develop writing skills.
